item.title: Small sink hole, but getting bigger, 13th August

item.title: Food waste collection person, 13th August
item.description:
Well whoever came on Tuesday for regular weekly food waste collection has broken the handle on one of the waste bins and just left it like this shown on pictures Please send new wast e bin that can be hanged on fence as there are foxes around every night and will be knocking it over if left like this. Unbelievable that person works for you, breaks the equipment and just leave it like this for further issues for tenants??

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 192, Gloucester Terrace, Paddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked bin chute, 13th August
item.description:
Our bin has been blocked for nearly 2 weeks Foul smells and flyes accumulating. There needs to be clear signage indicating that only small items to be disposed of. This will help in reducing the cost inpications the council continualy faces.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Valette Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Street tree canopy too large, tree possibly unsuitable for size of space can it be pruned/reduced please?, 13th August
item.description:
Plane tree planted outside No 90 Ravensbourne Avenue not long ago, seems too big for the space it occupies with only a short distance between the grass verge and the perimeter of No 90. Accordingly as a young tree its canopy is growing vigorously over the garden of No 90 and is also starting to grow into the garden of No 88. It is pushing into and distorting the growth of a tree planted in the garden of No 90 many years ago which is a problem for both trees that is likely to worsen as the plane tree continues its growth into the garden.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ravensbourne Avenue, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet
